intro: Plantago lagopus, commonly known as the common plantain, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring rosettes of broad, waxy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in a spike, which are pollinated by wind. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its fibrous root system helps stabilize soil, making it an important plant in ecological restoration efforts.
